caption: Digital Signature
description: The Digital Signature object contains information about the cryptographic mechanism used to verify the authenticity, integrity, and origin of the file or application.
name: digital_signature

algorithm.description: The digital signature algorithm used to create the signature, normalized to the caption of 'algorithm_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

algorithm_id.description: The identifier of the normalized digital signature algorithm.

created_time.description: The time when the digital signature was created.

state.description: The digital signature state defines the signature state, normalized to the caption of 'state_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

state_id.description: The normalized identifier of the signature state.

2.caption: Expired
2.description: The digital signature is invalid because its timestamp does not fall within the certificate's validity period.

3.caption: Revoked
3.description: The digital signature is invalid due to certificate revocation.

4.caption: Suspended
4.description: The digital signature is invalid due to certificate suspension.

5.caption: Pending
5.description: The digital signature state is pending.

6.caption: Untrusted
6.description: The digital signature is invalid because the certificate is rooted in an untrusted CA or is an untrusted self-signed certificate.

7.caption: Distrusted
7.description: The digital signature is invalid because the certificate is explicitly distrusted. Note that whereas revocation is global, distrust reflects local IT/security policy.

8.caption: WrongUsage
8.description: The digital signature is invalid because the certificate is not intended for code signing purposes.

9.caption: Bad
9.description: The digital signature is cryptographically invalid, e.g. a mismatched digest. This indicates possible tampering.

10.caption: Broken
10.description: The digital signature is malformed and could not be processed.
